page.title: 01Woodhalls
page.content: A population of about fifty occupies this area of sparsely populated country nestling five miles to the north of Dartmoor and twenty-five miles from Barnstaple and Exeter. It is an area of beautiful Devon country-side broken up by trees and hedgebanks, and dissected by the River Okement, the Hole Brook and a couple of small streams. The area comprises parts of the parishes of Jacobstowe,Exbourne and Monkokehampton.The market town of Hatherleigh lies to the north-west and Okehampton to the south.The long awaited decision on the Okehampton by- pass controversy is expected shortly, which, although it will not affect Woodhalls direcly, will have an indirect effect in terms of accessibility.
